1 # Install
2 
3 The following instructions have been tested in **Ubuntu 16.04** (Xenial), 64
4 bits.
5 
6 ### ROS Kinetic
7 
8 Set-up your computer to accept software from *packages.ros.org* and set-up your
9 keys following the steps described at
10 http://wiki.ros.org/kinetic/Installation/Ubuntu
11 
12 Now, install the ROS bare bones:
13 ```
14  # Installation
15  sudo apt-get update
16  sudo apt-get install python-wstool ros-kinetic-ros-base
17  # Initialize rosdep
18  sudo rosdep init
19  rosdep update
20 ```
21 
22 ### OpenRAVE
23 
24 OpenRAVE is one of the most powerful existing simulation
25 and motion planning environments. It is widely used in academia and industry.
26 
27 Here you can find the *automated* installation scripts:
28 https://github.com/crigroup/openrave-installation
29 
30 note:
31 
32 If the *automated* method fails, you can try the manual method:
33 https://crigroup.gitbooks.io/osrobotics/content/installation/motion_planning.html
34 
35 ### ROS Package installation
36 
37 Go to your ROS working directory:
38 ```
39  cd ~/catkin_ws/src
40 ```
41 Clone these repositories:
42 ```
43  git clone https://github.com/crigroup/or_octomap_plugin.git
44  git clone https://github.com/crigroup/openrave_catkin.git
45 ```
46 Install any missing dependencies using rosdep:
47 ```
48  rosdep update
49  rosdep install --from-paths . --ignore-src -y
50 ```
51 Now, compile your ROS workspace:
52 ```
53  cd ~/catkin_ws && catkin_make
54 ```
55 
56 ### Testing the Installation
57 
58 Make sure you always source the appropriate ROS setup file, e.g:
59 ```
60  source ~/catkin_ws/devel/setup.bash
61 ```
62 The following will run the tests of the ``or_octomap_plugin`` package:

or_octomap_plugin
Author(s): Yan Yu
